SENT.plain: Colonoscopic polypectomy is an effective method for prevention of colorectal cancer and has become one of the most common procedures worldwide
Most colorectal polyps can be removed safely by various polypectomy techniques; however, serious complications can occur
Postpolypectomy bleeding is the most common complication of colonoscopic polypectomy, accounting for 0.3% to 6.1% of polypectomy
This issue summarizes various endoscopic techniques to treat postpolypectomy bleeding
